title: Spicy Apple Cake
description: This delicious spicy apple cake recipe is made with fresh apples, spices, and sugar. It's a wonderfully perfect treat for the apple harvest season.
ingredients: 2 cups apple - peeled, cored, and chopped
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch square pan.
Sift together flour, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and nutmeg. Set aside.

Cream brown sugar, 1/2 cup shortening, and white sugar together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla. Beat in flour mixture alternately with milk, mixing until just combined. Stir in chopped apples.
Spread batter evenly in the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of cake comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool.

Combine confectioners' sugar, 1/4 cup shortening, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, and nutmeg in a medium bowl. Beat until frosting is light and creamy. Beat in evaporated milk 1 tablespoon at a time until desired spreading consistency is reached. Spread over top of cooled cake.
author: [{'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Linda'}]

featured_tweaks.text: Mmmm, this cake was so good. I made it exactly as directed except I used a different frosting only because I had some leftover from another cake. The next time I make this I will add one more cup of apples because more is better right?!
Will make this one again! (maybe for Thanksgiving dessert) I would prefer some more apple chunks in it, but that is just my preference. This cake is sweet and delicious.
